thread.title: Adomi Bridge Dedication

title: Adomi Bridge Dedication
text:
Atimpoku in Asuogyaman District, Austurland, Ghana — West Africa
Adomi Bridge Dedication
Dr. Kwame Nkrumah & Sir C.N.A. Clarke visited the Adome Bridge construction site & planted two palm trees in one hole in March 1955.
Odeneho Kwarfo Akoto, the paramount chief of the Akwamu also planted one palm tree as a symbol of Adome.
Topics. This historical marker is listed in these topic lists:
[Bridges & Viaducts](Results.asp?Search=Topic&CategoryID=50)• [Colonial Era](Results.asp?Search=Topic&CategoryID=4). A significant historical month for this entry is March 1955.
Location. 6° 14.363′ N, 0° 5.615′ E. Marker is in Atimpoku, Eastern Region (Austurland), in Asuogyaman District. Marker is on N2 (National Route N2), on the right when traveling east. The markers are under the western foundation of the Adomi Bridge on the grounds of the Adomi Bridge Garden and Restaurant.
[Touch for map](map.asp?markers=238349,238348,218887). Touch for directions.
Other nearby markers. At least 2 other markers are within 3 kilometers of this marker, measured as the crow flies.
[Asameni](m.asp?m=238348)(about 90 meters away, measured in a direct line); [Tree Columns Design at the Royal Senchi Hotel](m.asp?m=218887)(approx. 2.3 kilometers away).
